metadata.summary: To reduce the number of false positives, you may want to create false positive (FP) rules. FP rules filter out detections generated by the `report` action of detection & response (D&R) rules. These rules apply globally across all rule namespaces and targets.
use_cases: The typical use case for FP rules is to add exceptions from some detections that are cross-cutting (for example ignore all detections from a specific host), organization-specific exceptions (like ignoring alerts relating to a custom piece of software used in an organization), or suppressing errors from managed  rules you don't have direct access to.
